snippet: Mr. Bush, the former governor of Florida, could commandeer the center-right of the Republican Party, but his views on immigration and education may not please more conservative members.
abstract: Former Florida Gov Jeb Bush becomes first Republican to take overt step toward a presidential run in 2016, saying he will 'actively explore' bid; declaration is likely death knell for other would-be candidates, as most of his party's financial bundlers have close ties to Bush family.

byline.contributor: Michael Barbaro contributed reporting from New York, and Nicholas Confessore from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Mr. Bush, the former governor of Florida, could commandeer the center-right of the Republican Party, but his views on immigration and education may not please more conservative members.

headline.main: Jeb Bush Takes a Step Toward a Presidential Run
headline.print_headline: Bush Takes a Step Toward a Presidential Run
